alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 4:48PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hancock, south central Lee and southeastern Clark Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 447 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Lewistown, or 8 miles west of Canton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Warsaw and Alexandria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
